jobs.description:
Background

OctoML is an energetic new company changing how developers optimize and deploy machine learning models for their AI needs. We're a team of machine learning systems leaders focused on making machine learning (ML) more efficient and easier to deploy by… applying machine learning to it!

 

OctoML was founded by the creators of Apache TVM, a popular open-source compiler that transforms ML models into highly-efficient binary code optimized for the specific hardware and model architecture. We are building the Octomizer, a cloud-based "TVM as a Service" product that enables developers to optimize and package their ML models through a modern web app as well as a rich API surface.

 

We dream big but execute with focus and believe in creativity, productivity, and a balanced life. We value diversity in all dimensions.

 

Overview

We are looking for a Technical Sourcer who will be responsible for identifying and assessing technical talent for our Engineering, Product Management, and Solutions Architect teams.

 

You will work closely with our Recruiters and Engineering Hiring Managers to develop and execute strategies to locate and attract candidates to OctoML.

 

OctoML encourages practical and creative ways to surface leading talent, and we invest a lot of time activating passive candidates through a highly engaged approach. Our Recruiting Team is passionate about candidate experience, and this usually begins with the Sourcing Team. You will serve as the first point of contact/impression for OctoML and work to provide an incredible candidate experience throughout the interview process.

 

As a Technical Sourcer, you will:

  • Source active candidates from online databases, contact lists, internal databases, employee referrals.

  • Act as a search expert for a functional area(s) by understanding functional hiring needs, position specifications, and search requirements.

  • Partner with recruiters to generate ideas, leverage resources, and share information that facilitates an effective search process.

  • Screen candidates for availability, interest level, visa status, salary range, relocation needs, basic qualifications.

  • Enhance professional training and development by attending company-sponsored classes and meetings.

  • Act as a key recruiting partner in building and driving a pipeline of top candidates through multiple channels.

  • Optimize the recruiting process to maximize efficiency.

  • Coordinate and schedule initial candidate conversation with Recruiter and Hiring Managers.

  • Establish strong relationships with diverse candidates and organizations.

  • Build candidate pipelines from the ground up for Engineering, Product Manager, and Solutions Architect teams for OctoML.

  • Research and map out the talent pool in various industries.

  • Track metrics to analyze candidate pipelines with stakeholders.

  • Become a subject matter expert in research and sourcing for bespoke openings.

 

Your qualifications include:

  • 3+ years of sourcing experience (agency or internal)

  • Skilled at partnering with hiring teams to build effective sourcing and assessment with an ability to manage customer/partner expectations through a deep understanding of ROI

  • Participate in special projects/recruiting initiatives, including assessment of best practices in interviewing techniques, leveraging of internal sources of talent, and identification of top performers

  • Excellent written and verbal communication, as well as influencing skills

  • Organized, pragmatic people who thrive in a results-oriented environment are encouraged to apply

  • Experience creating, measuring, and scaling workflow between Candidates, Hiring Managers, and the Recruiting team

  • Track record of success in facilitating the identification and attraction of industry-leading talent for immediate business needs, as well as for critical long-term talent planning and pipelining

  • Bachelors Degree or equivalent experience

 

Location: Onsite (post-pandemic) in Seattle, WA or Remote

 

Our Benefits:

OctoML aims to provide the resources that employees need to be healthy and comfortable.

  • 4 weeks paid personal time off + company paid holidays and company downtime 2x per year

OctoML is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire based on an evaluation of abilities and effectiveness. We don't discriminate against employees based on any other personal characteristic or any classification protected by federal, state, or local law. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

jobs.title: Head of Talent Acquisition

jobs.title: Senior Technical Sourcer
jobs.description:
Hi there!

We're looking for a Senior Technical Sourcer to join the Recruiting Team at Zapier. Zapier’s on a mission to make everyone more productive at work. Zapier has helped millions of people build businesses through the power of automation.

Talented people can be found everywhere, but quite often the best people aren't even thinking about a career change. This is where Zapier’s Talent Sourcers come in. The sleuths and connectors of Zapier's Recruiting team, we spend our time searching far and wide across the web (from LinkedIn to GitHub to Twitter and everywhere in between). We dive deep into online communities to uncover great people, and reach out to these people in thoughtful ways to entice them to join Zapier.

Here at Zapier, we know Talent Sourcing can be more than pipeline building and candidate generation. Sourcing is a strategic and highly-valued technical craft that combines a deep curiosity to understand humans and their motivations around work, and the perseverance to find the right people and connect with them with the right opportunities in the right ways.

As Zapier’s resident expert in the talent market, you will help shape the future of our company and build a robust network of technical candidates to support Zapier's effort to attract, recruit, and hire a diverse and talented team that reflects our global customer base. You will need depth of craft knowledge, the energy to experiment, and the tenacity to persevere when faced with complexity and ambiguity. We are a small but ambitious team committed to high quality and big results, and we're looking for people to influence our strategy and achieve big results with us.

If you're curious, data-oriented, and consider yourself a savvy internet detective, then read on...

  • Our Commitment to Applicants
  • Culture and Values at Zapier
  • Zapier Guide to Remote Work
  • Zapier Code of Conduct
  • Diversity and Inclusivity at Zapier

About You

  • You have experience with talent sourcing as a craft. You have 4+ years of sourcing experience in an in-house (preferably SaaS) or agency environment. You’ve worked on hard-to-fill, niche, and highly technical roles, and you understand that sourcing is not a band-aid solution but a highly-valued technical craft and a critical part of strategic talent acquisition. You're also no stranger to deploying creative ways to find the candidates that no one else could find. You love manipulating boolean search strings to get results, and are familiar with LinkedIn Dark Matter ;)
  • You are a champion for diversity & inclusion. At Zapier, we know that hiring and fostering a diverse team is just the right thing to do. You advocate for DIBE at every stage of the sourcing funnel, and you’re keen to flex your creativity to find technically-skilled folks from underrepresented backgrounds.
  • You are metrics-driven and data-informed. You are comfortable using data to guide your decisions. You are able to weave together your knowledge of total addressable markets, industry benchmarks, and historical conversion rates to set expectations and guide yourself toward the smarter outcomes.
  • You take a methodical, systematic and experimental approach. You are able to break down problems into small parts, work backwards from your goal, and iterate and experiment constantly to find and reach the right candidates in the right way.
  • An appreciation of language. You enjoy words, both written and spoke. You are always looking for ways to better your communication skills. You are eager to translate your love of words into a creative job description, a clever outreach email, a well-articulated update to a hiring manager, or a compelling training brief.
  • You understand how to effectively prioritize. You are driven by a sense of urgency. You know how to manage multiple competing and shifting priorities, as well as the expectations of those you are working with.
  • You have fluency with modern tools. You have an appreciation for how technology (and automation!) make work better. You are comfortable using modern recruiting tools such as Gem, LinkedIn Recruiter, Talent Insights, and Greenhouse to accomplish your goals efficiently.  If you’ve not used these, you would feel comfortable researching them and pushing buttons to see what happens. You are also driven to find better tools to improve how we work.
  • You are comfortable with both autonomy and collaboration. You know that you don’t have all the answers, but you are confident that you can find them. You enjoy the freedom of self-directed work, and enjoy being able to figure things out for yourself. That being said, you are still comfortable asking questions, partnering with others to get work done, and sharing your ideas openly.
  • You are driven by an inherent curiosity. You are curious about people and their motivations around work. You want to know not just what people do, but why they do it. You are eager to learn about and source for novel roles, research talent availability and other topics you’re unfamiliar with. You also ask great questions.

Things You'll Do

  • Talent mapping: Research markets, companies, teams and role types based on industry, financial state, recent acquisitions and market events to drive your sourcing strategies for current or upcoming roles
  • Candidate generation: Build pipelines of qualified and diverse candidates from a variety of sources, including accessing pools of talent from historically underrepresented groups in the tech industry. Create and maintain long-term relationships with top talent in the industry.
  • Partnering with the business: Nurture strong relationships with recruiters, business leader and hiring managers to understand hiring needs and work with them to develop creative strategies for sourcing and attracting the best talent in a competitive market
  • Outreach and engagement: Engage top talent through multiple avenues including e-mail and LinkedIn outreach using a high-touch and personalized approach that equally reflects Zapier’s unique talent brand.
  • Data: Use high-quality qualitative and quantitative data to influence decisions and continuously improve on outcomes.
  • Experimentation: Experiment with new approaches, tactics, sources, and tools to maximize your impact. This may include A/B testing outreach, trying a new sourcing platform, or taking an alternative approach to finding candidates (and sharing the insights to teach others).
  • Projects and process improvement: Leading projects to improve and scale how we source at Zapier so we can build a best-in-class Talent Sourcing function.
  • Mentorship: Mentoring teammates on new ways to deepen their technical craft.
  • Sourcing enablement and education: Educating your partners on the Recruiting Team and in the business on ways to engage in and improve their sourcing.
  • Travel of 5% - 10% for company retreats that rotate to various cities throughout North America.
  • As a part of Zapier's all-hands philosophy, help customers via support to ensure they have the best experience possible.

This role will report into a centralized Sourcing function, and will partner with specific functional teams in Engineering, Product and Design. You’ll have a chance to dive deeply into what these teams are working on, their strategic priorities, the technologies they are using, and what they are building to make everyone more productive at work. At the same time, you will have opportunities to flex your sourcing and research chops in other areas of the business when needed. 

The Whole Package

Location: Remote - North America or Western Europe

Our flexible, distributed environment lets us work with the best people from around the world. Zapiens live in 40+ countries, including the United Kingdom, Thailand, India, Nigeria, Taiwan, Guatemala, New Zealand, Australia, and more!

Zapier offers:

  • Competitive salary
  • Healthcare + dental + vision coverage*
  • Retirement plan with 4% company match*
  • Profit-sharing program for 100% of Zapiens
  • $2,000 annual learning stipend for use on courses, conferences, and more—your choice
  • Two annual all-company retreats
  • 14 weeks paid leave for new parents of biological or adopted children
  • Customized Zapiversary rewards on your 1, 3, 5, 7 and 10 year work anniversaries
  • Leading-edge equipment. We set you up with an Apple laptop and provide an additional budget for you to choose other home office accessories and software you may need.
  • Time to renew. We encourage Zapiens to take at least 2 weeks off each year. Most of us take 4-5 weeks, in addition to locally recognized holidays.
  • Opportunity to work with Zapier’s amazing partners network

*While we take care of Zapiens around the world the best we can, healthcare and retirement plans are currently available specifically in the UK, Canada, and United States.

 

How to Apply

We have a non-standard application process designed to promote inclusion and equity. We first ask a few questions in our application form that would typically be asked at the start of an initial interview. This helps speed up the process and lets us get to know you a bit better right out of the gate. Please be sure to answer each question; the resume and CV fields are optional.

After you apply, you are going to hear back from us—even if we don’t see an immediate fit with our team. In fact, throughout the process, we strive to make sure you never go more than seven days without hearing from us.

We're excited to work with talented and empathetic people, and do not discriminate based on race, color, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, genetic information, pregnancy, age, or any other status protected by local law. Our code of conduct provides a beacon for the kind of company we strive to be, and we celebrate our differences because those differences are what allow us to make a product that serves a global user base.

Zapier is committed to inclusion. As part of this commitment, Zapier will ensure that people with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodations are needed to participate in the job application or interview process, please contact jobs@zapier.com.

We’re a North Vancouver-born SaaS company with a distributed remote team across Canada, and our platform is modernizing the world of practice management software. We enable the likes of physiotherapists, mental health counsellors, chiropractors, and other allied health practitioners to run their practices in a digital-first way through features such as online booking, charting, scheduling, secure video, and billing along with an evolving library of features.
 
Over 21,000 healthcare practices globally are now running on Jane. Last year we processed over 37 million patient appointments, and our scheduling application alone handles on average 10 million API calls per day. We’re profitable, product-led and growing organically to the point where 85% of our customer growth is either from customer referrals or word of mouth. Growth like this is unique, especially in the world of SaaS, and it doesn’t happen by chance. We have a brilliant team of over 240 employees who all do an amazing job of listening to our customers, building what they need, and providing industry-leading support.
 
This year alone we’ve grown our development team from 36 to 63, and the product team has doubled as a whole. 2022 is going to be a big year for Jane as we’re investing heavily into patient experience with our first patient-facing mobile app, enhancing our telehealth experience, building our own (J)analytics platform, working on global insurance integrations, and introducing new features like HIPAA compliant chat.

Of course, it’s not all about the numbers, but this puts into perspective the scale of Jane, from the thousands of practitioners whose lives are made easier each day to the millions of patients receiving treatment. If you’re the type of person excited by this growth, we’d love to speak with you.

Why Zoovu?

Zoovu is an award-winning leader in Conversational Search, we’re 190 employees strong and fast-growing. With 7 office locations worldwide, we have the advantage to tackle a vast variety of industries including consumer electronics, health & beauty, manufacturing and telecommunications, delivering exceptional value to our clients.

Joining the Zoovu team means all of the opportunity, growth and advancement that can only come from a trusted industry leader.

What does Zoovu do?

Ever tried finding the right laptop, facial cream or even washing machine online? Not easy, right? That's the problem we're solving for more than 2,500 businesses and millions of consumers worldwide, every second. Our industry-leading conversational search platform allows business users to create, configure, design, monitor and optimize digital sales assistants. Like a sales person in a store, those "virtual sales people" help consumers find the right product through a natural human-like conversation. Both leading enterprise businesses such as Amazon, 3M or P&G as well as small and medium-sized retailers and brands use Zoovu to help their customers, increase online sales, improve their CX, and gain valuable consumer insights.

More so now than ever before, brands need ways to differentiate themselves and elevate the conversation with their customers and prospects. The market is prime for a solution that can leverage modern technologies to streamline the way customers find the products and services that truly meet their needs.

 

The Role

Zoovu is looking for an experienced IT Recruiter to support our team in Poland. We are a fast-growing company with ambitious plans to continue this growth and need a passionate recruiter with expert sourcing skills to help us along this journey.

You will be part of shaping the future for years to come!

 

This role is responsible for recruiting tech candidates in our EMEA markets. Based in Poland, you will be part of our diverse talent team with responsibility for;

  • Supporting hiring managers at all stages of the recruitment process.
  • Using your expert sourcing skills to find, engage and attract passive candidates using LinkedIn, Github, job boards, social media and alternative search techniques
  • Building and nourishing talent pipelines for future hiring
  • Reviewing advert responses, shortlisting CVs and conducting screening interviews with candidates
  • Being Zoovu’s ambassador and provide a world-class candidate journey that means every candidate has a fantastic experience and wants to join our amazing team;
  • Use our ATS (Workable) to manage candidates and roles and deliver weekly recruitment metrics and data.

Requirements

 

Essential Skills;

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience
  • Skilled technical recruiter
  • Experience in sourcing talent in Europe (especially Poland, other European markets like Belgium/Germany/Austria is a plus)
  • Ability to build and maintain talent pipelines in line with company strategy
  • High-level understanding of Zoovu's tech stack (Javascript, React, node.js, Java)
  • Great people skills that will let you build good relationships with candidates and make them want to join Zoovu
  • Experience with candidate searching and sourcing through online channels (LinkedIn, job boards, social media professional networks and other hiring avenues).
  • Experience with Linkedin Recruiter / Recruiter Lite (search building etc.)
  • Experience in candidate management
  • Previous experience in agency or in house recruitment
  • Strong written and communications skills
  • Analytical thinker with a problem solving mindset
  • Good time management skills with the ability to handle various open positions simultaneously
  • Strong communication skills in English is a must!
  • Energetic, self starter

Desirable Skills;

  • Proficiency with Applicant Tracking system (Workable)
  • Recruiting in a high volume fast paced environment
  • Ability to use Boolean search
  • Second language (French and German);

Benefits

  • An attractive salary and a great opportunity for professional development within the company
  • We’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas
  • We are a remote first company and we have an office in the heart of Wroclaw
  • Open and friendly organizational culture, a clear structure with a go-for-it-attitude
  • Benefits package ( Private health care, Sport subscription)
  •  

We look forward to receiving your cv (in English please)!

 

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Zoovu is committed to equal opportunity employment regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or any other basis as protected by applicable law. We are committed to increasing diversity across our team and ensuring that Zoovu is a place where people from all backgrounds can make an impact.

jobs.title: VP of People
jobs.description:
Otus is solving two of the biggest challenges facing K-12 education: teachers need to get more things done in a limited amount of time and all stakeholders (students, families, teachers, and administrators) need access to relevant student performance data.

As an executive member of a growing team, you must possess a strong work ethic and be upbeat, driven, intelligent, well-organized, articulate, share a passion for learning new technology, and thrive in a fun, fast-paced environment.

You will have the opportunity to immediately contribute and see the results of your work in use by students, teachers, parents and district administrators across the country.

Culture and People: building out our organizational practices, principles, and modes of operating to make Otus the best possible place to work.

Human Resources: implementing hiring, onboarding, compensation, review, and other personnel practices that are foundational for individual growth, team performance, and company compliance.

Recruiting: oversee the strategy and execution of our sourcing, interviewing, and attracting the next cohort of amazing Otus team members, including both technical and non-technical and both remote and on-site.

Process: refining, creating, contributing to existing processes

Requirements

  • You have led strategic People and Human Resources initiatives, at early-stage or late-stage companies, non-profits, or organizations.
  • You know how to recruit candidates with specialized backgrounds (including highly-technical ones), and are ready to scale a Recruiting organization to grow this function around you.
  • You believe that people are a business, full stop. You believe that investments in Culture, HR and People have limitless potential.
  • You are motivated by the opportunity to work at a dynamic fast-paced company where the magnitude of your contributions are only bound by your abilities.
  • You are respectful, empathetic, honest, and energetic.
  • You are willing to work remotely or on-site in Chicago, IL.

Benefits and Perks

  • Competitive salary and employee stock options
  • 20 PTO days per year
  • 12 paid holidays including your birthday and a day to do something you love to do
  • Up to 12 weeks of parental leave and great work/life balance
  • Our team mostly works remotely from the comfort of their homes (HQ in Chicago)
  • Excellent medical, dental, and vision insurance
  • Professional development/tuition reimbursement
  • Home office improvement budget
  • Life Insurance and disability benefits
  • 401K with an employer match (up to 4%)

Otus is an Equal Opportunity Employer and embraces diversity of every kind. You must be legally authorized to work in the US. Unfortunately, the company is unable to support sponsorships at this time.

jobs.title: HR Generalist
jobs.description:
Position Overview:

As the Human Resources (HR) Generalist, you'll help empower, develop, and care for CS' most valuable asset - our people! The Human Resources Generalist is both a strategic and hands-on role that provides full cycle Human Resources support to our CS staff. The role is critical in executing our people initiatives, providing great internal employee support, and driving HR functional excellence and process improvement. 

Defining Success for this Position:

  • Success in one year will include mastering all tasks in management of the employee life cycle and the annual processes such as onboarding, open enrollment, and recruitment, 
  • Support the HR Manager in reaching these Strategic Plan Measures by 2026:
    • Quality of recruitment process: Positions filled within 60 days
    • Employees will recommend CS as a place to work to a friend (0-10)
    • Staff move across CS salary growth levels at equitable rates
    • 80% of staff respond favorably on fairness and feeling valued
  • Internal communication strategy is streamlined for all HR projects.
  • Employees have a full understanding of benefits policies, labor laws, and best practices.
  • All internal processes, including hiring, internships, and onboarding, take place equitably, meeting all CS staff's needs.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Talent Strategy

  • Drive and implement company HR initiatives in partnership with the HR Manager.
  • Support the establishment of metrics of accountability to monitor progress against org-wide objectives related to HR and initiatives that map to those objectives.
  • A true hands-on approach as well as the ability to successfully monitor the "pulse" of the employees to ensure a high level of employee engagement
    • Create employee engagement plans, getting necessary budget approval to initiate activities such as creating and managing a “culture committee”

Talent Management

  • Create and drive effective and positive employee relations, retention, and reward programs.
  • Support the monitoring of employee relation concerns and address concerns as appropriate, escalating to HR Manager as needed.
  • Proactively implement strategies that mitigate risk and ensure a healthy, happy work environment
  • Benefits Management
    • Educate employees on benefits options, communicate open enrollment deadlines and implications of missing deadlines, assist employees with claims as needed.
    • Communicate with terminating employees to ensure they understand options, including COBRA
    • Maintain accurate plan documents for all benefits and make them easily accessible to all stakeholder groups 
  • Manage Onboarding and offboarding process, including trainings, analyzing data, strategy, etc.
    • Generate official internal documents such as offer letters, salary increase letters, etc
  • Oversee major HR processes (i.e. compensation and benefits), including trainings, adjustments, and internal communications strategy.
    • Compensation: Manage strategy on level setting new positions within the compensation structure
    • Oversee strategy in implementing high-quality workplace trainings, including mandatory anti-sexual harassment and non-discrimination trainings, benefits, and supervisor trainings.
  • Support managers in taking the appropriate disciplinary action against employees who violate rules and regulations, and address employee grievances

Talent Acquisition

  • Oversee the entire recruitment and hiring process and strategy, including supporting hiring teams as needed
  • Continuously build and oversee a candidate pipeline and nurturing campaigns, hosting recruitment events for both potential employees and interns.
  • Develop a strategy in collaboration with our communications team to continuously improve CS' employer brand value
    • Oversee response strategy for feedback from sites such as glassdoor
    • Oversee strategy for improving CS' careers page and overall outreach

Data Analysis, Records Management, and Visualization

  • Track and report on HR metrics including those related to talent acquisition, employee satisfaction, and participation in benefits programs.
  • Analyze turnover to identify trends and develop and implement employee retention strategies.
  • Run reports and create Tableau visualizations for staff, including hiring teams during the hiring process.
  • Coordinate completion of HR Functions, including maintaining personnel files, FMLA and PFL.
  • Manage and update strategic plan measures that HR currently oversees.

Additional Responsibilities

  • Internships: Improve and manage the summer internship program, including:
    • Build strategic partnerships with external programs to increase and maintain diverse intern candidates.
    • Oversee outreach and recruitment.
    • Develop and facilitate courses for summer interns.
  • HR Technology
    • Oversee the management of the internal employee intranet
    • Manage and/or support our many HRIS systems including Knack, Insperity, Timestar, Breezy, Lattice, Asana, and Slack.
  • Employee Communication & Education
    • Provide quality, timely customer service to all staff
    • Respond to all employee emails and phone calls, notifying HR manager as needed

Professional Experience and Qualifications:

  • Resume that shows steady progression in HR for the last 3-5+ years.
  • Skilled at examining data (quantitative & qualitative) and metrics to improve the organization.
  • Tech-savvy: skilled in creating clear presentations and becoming familiar with new software easily
  • Passionate about improving processes and developing innovative HR solutions.
  • Knowledge of best practices in HR, including expertise and comfort in facilitating meaningful and difficult conversations with a wide range of stakeholders.
  • Excellent “soft skills” including verbal and written communication skills. Experience in facilitating is a plus.
  • Experience managing and facilitating organizational change efforts while building relationships and creating buy-in, ideally in a highly matrixed, geographically dispersed context.
  • Advanced project management skills; ability to lead projects at a level to influence and obtain buy-in, and then drive execution and achievement of the right results
  • Able to work independently to achieve goals while being a team player.

Software/Apps Used:

  • Asana
  • Google Business Apps
  • Zoom video conferencing software
  • Knack database software
  • Slack
  • Breezy
  • Survey platforms (i.e. Jotform, Google forms)
  • Lattice
  • Tableau

Salary Range:

The salary range for this position is $72k to $90.2k, depending on experience, proficiency, and qualifications.

Note that our salary structure is transparent and ensures that salary advancement is attainable with increased tenure, performance, independence, responsibility, and embodiment of our organizational values.

Work Environment:

This is a fully remote position. The person must live on the east coast, ideally near NYC, Washington DC, or Atlanta, GA.

Travel may be required at times (2-3/year) for company retreats and events. (All travel is currently suspended due to COVID.)

Diversity and Inclusion:

We strive for inclusivity and diversity by attracting extraordinary people from diverse backgrounds and lived experiences. We seek to employ an all-star team of people who vary by their race and ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, nationality, age, culture, religion, veteran status, physical and mental abilities. We promote equal opportunity in the recruitment, selection, training, compensation, promotion, and benefits of all employees.

COVID-19 Vaccination Mandate:

COVID-19 vaccination is mandatory for all Community Solutions staff—full-time, part-time, and contracted. Vaccination documentation must be provided to Community Solutions. Vaccination information is completely confidential between the staff member and HR.

jobs.title: Head of People
jobs.description:
Creoate is the UK's largest B2B wholesale marketplace, helping over 50,000 retailers source products for their stores.

We use cutting-edge technology to help small businesses owners run their businesses in a better way, making it easy, fast and more profitable for them to source fresh products for their customers.

Creoate is a VC-backed company and extensively covered in TechCrunch and Sifted (hottest investments shortlist), with an experienced team who have worked at or invested in Farfetch, Ocado, Vinted, Lyst and Deloitte. Joining our team of 26, you will get all the benefits of working in a start up environment (ownership, agility, responsibility and learning) and building a global business.

 

**About the role**

We are looking for a Head of People to lead the new in-house People (HR) Operations Team. This is an exciting opportunity to have an influential role in guiding the formation of the team, while gaining exposure to all aspects of recruiting, people management, employee happiness and benefits for a fast-growing, distributed team across the UK and Europe. 
 

**You Will**

  • Work with Founders to plan and execute the People & Hiring strategy
  • Build and refine a scaleable recruitment and on-boarding process to support hiring managers and employees
  • Coordinate and lead recruitment pipeline development, including job boards, consultants and agency relationships
  • Hire, mentor and manage future People (HR) specialists
  • Lead initiatives on Wellbeing, Diversity & Inclusion and Company Values
  • Be the first point of contact for HR related queries 
  • Proactively improve our HR documentation, automation and resources to achieve scale for our fast-growing organisation


**Your Profile**

  • Knowledge of HR best practices and UK employment law, ideally with 2-3 years direct HR or People Operations. International experience an advantage.
  • Excellent communication, empathy and teamwork attitude as you act as a trusted advisor to new talent and existing employees
  • Experience in HR softwares and processes, including Breezy a bonus
  • Passionate about elevating the employee experience and business performance
  • Curious about new HR and employee initiatives, challenging the status quo to help formulate a more diverse and inclusive workplace environment
  • Highly organised with a proven ability to multi-task, tackle challenges and design solutions
  • Excellent team work, collaborating with cross-functional teams and departments in a high growth, fast paced environment

jobs.title: Events and Experience Manager
jobs.description:
Zearn is the nonprofit educational organization behind Zearn Math, the top-rated math learning platform used by 1 in 4 elementary students nationwide. Zearn Math supports teachers with research-backed curriculum and digital lessons proven to double the learning gains of a typical year of instruction. Zearn Math instructional materials - including 400+ hours of digital math learning - are free for teachers and families. Zearn also offers school- and district-wide licenses and professional development to support implementation. Everything Zearn does is driven by the belief that every kid can be a math kid.

 

The Events and Experience Manager will play a crucial role in the Zearn team member experience by enhancing and enriching Zearn’s culture. The Events and Experience Manager will be the key contributor in cultivating Team member experiences in our NY Office and Remote work environments in order to attract and retain world-class talent and support an environment where the Team feels connected to Zearn’s mission each day. Reporting to the Director of People Operations, the Events and Experience Manager will collaborate with team members across the organization to organize memorable company events, project manage our office redesigns and moves as we continue to grow, assist in designing and executing an onboarding experience that sets the foundation for inclusivity, and work alongside the People Operations team in ensuring that all employees have the opportunity to make lasting connections at work and feel a part of the Zearn community each day.

 

The Events and Experience Manager role is essential in ensuring a high level of employee engagement and satisfaction, and will be critical in nurturing the positive employee experience for all Zearners.

 

What you do:

  • Identify, design, and implement meaningful opportunities for all Zearners, office and remote, to engage with one another to sustain a deep connection to Zearn’s core values and promote retention, high employee engagement, and a thriving culture:
    • Spearhead planning and logistics for team events (large and small), engaging company outings, and motivating team building activities (virtual and live- when safe to do so)
    • Partner with People leadership to ensure a memorable (and measurable), positive employee experience at all phases of the employee lifecycle:
      • New Hires: redesigning the onboarding experience; creation of new hire buddy system; executing new hire specific welcoming and integration events.
      • Zearners: facilitating the continuous improvement of bi-monthly townhall meetings; executing team focused events at the departmental level; creating thoughtful employee recognition spotlight opportunities; creating opportunities for Zearners to connect based on location, interests, etc.
      • Outgoing Zearners: creation of “Zearn Alumni” to allow outgoing Zearners to continue the connection to the Zearn team.
  • Execute on strategies designed to improve engagement and manage programs designed to foster it including reward and recognition programs, as well as wellness initiatives.
  • Stay abreast of global events that may impact Zearners from various backgrounds and demographics in order to contribute to the People Operations communications and response plans
  • Manage the operations and strategy for the Zearn office space:
    • Manage the Office Administrative Assistant to ensure seamless and successful office operations
    • Project manage any office moves, construction, or commission/decommissioning of office space
    • Oversee the collection, use, and analysis of workplace utilization rates and trends in order to make informed decisions on long-term workspace plans
    • Manage the successful administration of all pandemic-related health and safety protocols and policies

 

Who you are:

  • A Bachelor's degree in a related field, or equivalent experience
  • 5+ years’ of progressive, professional HR experience
  • Ability to proactive create and implement programs to drive employee engagement
  • Prior experience in an Office Management, Community Management, or Event Management position (Startup/tech environment – big plus)
  • Experience creating teambuilding events for virtual teams
  • Excellent time management skills and ability to multitask and prioritize work.
  • Strong organization, communication, and planning skills
  • Proven record in forging strong relationships with the ability to persuade, negotiate and communicate effectively
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Power point) and email tools (G-suite strongly preferred)
  • A strong commitment to Zearn’s mission of providing an exceptional education to all children
  • This role is fully remote but may require some travel for events when safe to do so

jobs.title: Business Recruiter
jobs.description:
About Vouch:

Insurance... sounds slow, old-fashioned, and unexciting. Exactly. Insurance is broken, and it's failing fast-moving, innovative startups.

Vouch is a new, technology-first insurance company backed with $160M in funding from world-class investors. Like Stripe for payments or Brex for credit cards, Vouch is creating the go-to business insurance for high-growth companies.

We're doing this by making insurance fast, responsive, and focused on our customers -high growth and innovative companies. Instead of printed PDF applications and week-long waits, Vouch is building new technology to solve real problems, writing policies that actually cover relevant startup scenarios, and designing simple experiences in an otherwise frustrating industry.

What does a work environment look like at Vouch?

Vouch has a 3-HQ model: Office-Based, Office-Linked, and Remote-First. This role is Remote-First, which means that team members can work from anywhere in the U.S. so long as they can work during Vouch core collaboration hours (9 am-3 pm PT Mon-Fri). ** Although this role is considered Remote, we prefer having this candidate be based in either the Central or Eastern time zones where most of the support and hiring will be based.

 

Role Overview: 

Vouch is looking for a Business Recruiter to help us accelerate our growth as we aim to grow the Vouch team to ~250 over the next year! In this role, you will partner with the Vouch leadership team to fill various positions with different levels of complexity that span across our Go to Market and Insurance Operations teams. In addition to sourcing, interviewing, and closing great candidates, you'll get a chance to improve upon our recruiting strategy, making sure that candidates have a uniquely positive experience from the first introduction through to their onboarding. In addition to recruiting, our team is currently working on exciting projects from University and Intern programs, Employer Branding, and tools and partnerships implementations. We are looking for a recruiter who is passionate about building a great candidate experience, is data-driven with a focus on DEI initiatives, and values a true partnership with internal stakeholders to bring world-class talent to the Vouch team. This role will report to our Business Recruiting Manager alongside one other Recruiter and one Recruiting Coordinator.

 

Here's what you'll do:

  • Manage full-cycle recruiting process for non-technical roles (Sales, Success, and Insurance Operations)
  • Identify and engage unique and/or passive candidates through creative sourcing techniques, leveraging LinkedIn Recruiter and other sourcing partners
  • Regularly manage pipeline activity, maintain ATS (Greenhouse) data integrity, and proactively share data-centric updates with internal stakeholders
  • Plan and execute recruiting events and campaigns that attract top talent 
  • Partner closely with hiring managers to understand teams, prioritize hiring needs, and build a seamless interview process that helps us bring the best candidates to our teams
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams like People Ops, HR, Finance, and Legal to deliver a high-quality and holistic candidate experience
  • Ensure that all roles are managed from end to end, adhering to our processes 
  • Recommend ideas and strategies related to recruitment that will contribute to the long-range growth of the company, implementing any new procedures and fine-tuning standard processes for recruiting

 

Here's what we're looking for:

  • Experience in a fast-growth, dynamic environment and managing multiple pipelines/priorities
  • 3+ years of overall work experience with 2+ years of full-cycle recruiting experience
  • Success record of high volume sourcing and consistently achieving hiring goals 
  • Strong organization and time management skills 
  • Experience partnering closely with hiring managers to consistently improve the hiring process 
  • Passion for building diverse teams
  • Working knowledge of Greenhouse or similar ATS 

 

Vouch provides a number of benefits to help you bring your best self to work:

  • Competitive compensation and equity packages
  • Health, dental, and vision insurance
  • Parental leave
  • Flexible vacation time (Unlimited PTO)
  • Wellness allowance ($80/month)
  • Technology allowance ($100/month)
  • Monthly Doordash credits ($80/month) 

 

Vouch believes in putting our people first and building a diverse team is at the front of everything that we do. We welcome people from different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate the diversity of our growing team. 

If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please direct your inquiries to recruiting@vouch.us.

jobs.title: Head of People Operations
jobs.description:
Who We Are

Rippleworks Foundation provides high-growth social ventures the practical support they need to improve more lives. Rippleworks’ programs directly support 200+ fast growing, deeply impactful social ventures around the world.

Rippleworks Projects: Rippleworks leads short-term, high-impact projects where social ventures tackle top operational priorities by working alongside industry-leading executives who bring deeply relevant entrepreneurial experience.

Rippleworks Leaders Studio: Rippleworks designs and delivers expert-led learning programs designed specifically for social venture leaders. Rippleworks partners with leading industry executives to run interactive, results-driven learning programs where social venture leaders gain the critical skills they need to deliver impact at scale.

Rippleworks Capital: Rippleworks provides hard-to-find capital required for scale (grants and investments in the $1M-$3M range), and has distributed $50M+ to scaling social ventures since 2018.

We are a 25+ person team on a mission to help impactful ventures thrive. We strive to create the best possible workplace for purpose-driven professionals to make an outsized difference in the world: learning, growing, and having fun together along the way.

Rippleworks has been named one of the World’s Most Innovative Companies (by Fast Company) and one of the world’s Best Workplaces for Innovators (by Fast Company and Accenture).

We are an equal opportunity employer and committed to improving diversity, equity, and inclusion at Rippleworks. Candidates from underrepresented minority groups (Black, Latinx, Native American or individuals with national origins from developing countries that reflect the communities we serve) are strongly encouraged to apply. Rippleworks also complies with federal and state disability laws and makes reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please email christina@rippleworks.org.


The Role

The Head of People Operations challenges us to constantly improve the value we provide to our team, ensure we are executing our people programs with excellence, and live to our values.

Responsibilities

Specifically, you will be responsible for:

  • People Strategy: Serve as a core business partner to Rippleworks CEO and leadership team; diagnose people needs and collaborate with others to implement solutions
  • Talent Acquisition: Be accountable for our recruiting and hiring process and oversee its success
  • Onboarding: Assume overall responsibility for our onboarding process for new employees to ensure an exceptional first day/week/month experience
  • Employee Relations: Establish a safe place for employees; provide career counseling when needed, listen to and address feedback and concerns in a highly professional and confidential manner
  • Learning & Growth: Manage and improve our career framework, talent reviews, promotion process, feedback process; support leadership development by coaching people managers; deliver learning & growth programs with exceptional value
  • Culture: Ensure we are living to our values and building a great culture; shape our people practices and policies to drive our aspirational culture; lead our culture survey implementation and action planning; ensure we have a healthy and engaging flexible, hybrid remote work environment
  • Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion: Serve as a key sponsor for our DEI vision; be accountable for people-related DEI goals and programs
  • Total Rewards: Have overall ownership for our total rewards program; manage our equitable and transparent salary structure; conduct salary reviews and annual market benchmarking
  • Organizational Design: Ensure we have an optimal organizational structure that helps us achieve our mission and strategic goals
  • Operational Excellence: Work closely with team leads to codify how we work and make decisions
  • Compliance: Maintain current knowledge of HR practices and regulations to ensure compliance with local, state, and federal employment laws

Requirements


About You
  • Social Impact: You are deeply passionate about social impact and eager to work in a sector that helps improve people’s lives.
  • Expertise in the People Function: You have a solid knowledge across all HR practices and in-depth expertise in at least a couple of them (e.g., talent development, total rewards, employee experience management, people operations). You are experienced at designing and implementing lightweight yet highly effective learning and growth programs and other core people practices (e.g., hiring, employee engagement) in pursuit of honoring an organization’s values and culture.
  • Collaboration: You are an exceptional teammate, with a no-task-is-too-small mentality in helping teams reach their goals. You build trusting partnerships in a cross-team environment to meet shared objectives.
  • Managing Diverse Relationships: You embrace and relate well to a wide variety of personalities, communication/thinking styles, cultures, backgrounds, and other qualities. You value differences and quickly find common ground, treating everyone fairly and equitably.
  • Professionalism and Integrity: You have unquestionable personal integrity and maintain a high level of professionalism and credibility throughout all of your communications and actions. People trust you to safeguard and keep confidential all sensitive information.

Sano matches those with medical conditions with opportunities to contribute to research, via our unique online platform. We also provide personalised medical insights, information and recommendations. The platform is private-by-design. We feel strongly that people should be in full control of their sensitive health data and choose who can access it.

Taking part in research is currently hard to do and a poor experience for the patient. Finding out about opportunities is haphazard, and there is often little meaningful return for those who take the time and care to get involved. The result is that organisations with cutting edge theories and medicines to test, can’t find the right patients to work with. On being a People Product Lead at balena

At balena, we treat our People function as a product, where our team members are our customers. The People team owns the tools and processes we use to hire, support, and grow our globally distributed team of ~100 people (and counting). They think deeply about the team member experience and how to enable all of us to be productive and fulfilled in our roles. They help to build connections across the team and promote the well-being of all balenistas.

In this role, you will work closely with both the People team and other cross-functional teams, including engineers, to build and maintain systems to support and scale our team. You will solve problems from first principles, borrowing from existing playbooks as appropriate, but always with an eye towards what makes sense for our unique context. Examples of the kinds of projects you may work on include: designing a global compensation calculator; creating career development pathways within a relatively flat organizational structure; establishing a mentorship program; and setting up the optimal legal structure for a distributed team. You can see how we approach challenges like these in our blog post about building our scheduling tool.

Balena has been remote-first since 2015, and we’re always looking for new ways to create the best possible organization for global teams. We believe everybody should have the opportunity to do fulfilling, meaningful work, regardless of where they live. Help us build the future of distributed work.

 

Responsibilities
  • Build scalable, creative solutions to enable our team’s success
  • Gather and act upon team member feedback to iterate on People products
  • Maintain, improve, and automate existing workflows such as hiring, on/offboarding, etc
  • Own and update our team member policies and guidelines
  • Communicate with team members and share resources about how to be successful and productive at balena
  • Provide strategic input on organizational structure, culture, hiring, development, etc.
  • Stay up to date on requirements and trends in building globally distributed teams
  • Be a role model of our culture and seek opportunities to share our way of working with the world

Requirements

  • Experience building and managing processes across the employee lifecycle
  • “Product builder” mentality. You care deeply about the experience of users (aka balena team members) and look for intuitive, elegant solutions to their problems
  • Ability to work across teams (including People, Ops, Product, and Engineering) to push projects to completion
  • Open to finding unconventional solutions to existing problems using technology and automation
  • Open-minded, with a willingness to challenge and be challenged
  • Ability to manage ambiguity and make tradeoff decisions in a fluid environment
  • Continuous improvement mindset, with a desire to make self and others more effective
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and fluency in English

 

Bonus points
  • Familiarity with globally distributed and/or asynchronous teams including the cultural, legal, and operational implications
  • Experience leading high-impact projects in a fast-paced, dynamic startup environment
  • Background partnering with cross-functional teams, especially engineers, to build great products

Make sure to let us know if any of these items apply to you!

Benefits

  • Work with a talented and globally distributed team
  • Equipment of your choice
  • Remote-friendly
  • Flexible working hours
  • Flexible vacation policy
  • Annual company gathering in an international location
  • We send you hardware for side projects!
 
Who we are

Balena is a highly distributed company that has embraced a remote-first approach since 2013. We are a group of individuals from across the globe working together to achieve our mission: “reduce friction for fleet owners and unlock the power of physical computing”. For us, this means removing the barriers to entry for developing IoT products, whether that’s easing software deployments with balenaCloud, simplifying image flashing with balenaEtcher, or offering our own hardware based on our experience seeing thousands of devices running in production environments. We're engineering a complete, end-to-end solution that makes it easy for any developer to build applications at the Edge.

 
How we work
  • We place trust and autonomy in our team to own the outcome of their work.
  • We practice radical candor and transparency with open, honest, and clear communications.
  • We embrace first-principles thinking and constantly challenge our assumptions.
  • We organize ourselves based on the best use of our collective abilities to solve our highest priority problems at any given time, rather than by a strict hierarchy.
  • We’re not afraid to fail as long as we learn from our mistakes.
  • We’re always looking for common patterns that allow us to reduce complexity.
  • We embrace short-term pain for long term gain, building products that will stand the test of time.

Role Summary - Recruiting Lead

The Recruiting Lead at High Speed Ventures will be responsible for:

  1. Implementing, overseeing, and managing all inbound and outbound recruiting activities for High Speed Ventures, our portfolio of companies, and other external companies that we may work with in the future. 
  2. Overseeing and improving our talent evaluation, interviewing, and scoring processes, both for new hires and for the existing teams of portfolio companies that we acquire. 
  3. Overseeing, implementing, and managing the onboarding process for new team members into the High Speed Ventures ecosystem, including providing feedback back to the executive team on performance of candidates that we place.

 

In short, the Recruiting Lead will be building “talent on demand” for High Speed Ventures. The person in this role will need to be able to masterfully source candidates and sell the opportunity, oversee the hiring process to ensure that we're meeting the needs of our various companies, and ensure that the people we hire get off to a strong start. This is an incredibly critical role for us, and we're deeply committed to finding the best person for the job.

Success Outcomes

We don't hand people a list of “desired past experience” like 99% of job descriptions out there. We are an outcome-driven business that focuses on results. 

In support of this approach, here are the three critical success outcomes that our Recruiting Lead is expected to achieve:

Source World Class Talent

Ensure that High Speed Ventures and all of our related entities have access to world-class talent when we need it. This goal will be achieved primarily by building a world-class outbound talent sourcing process, because we firmly believe that the best people aren't looking for jobs - we need to go seek them out and provide them with incredible opportunities to do the best work they've ever done. 

Key Responsibilities
  • Gather position requirements from stakeholders and build an Opportunity Profile (like this one) that will define the desired outcomes of the position.
  • Implement an outbound sourcing strategy to ensure that our pipeline is filled with highly qualified candidates in a short period of time. 
  • Perform initial discussions with potential candidates to sell the opportunity and evaluate for values alignment.
  • Maintain clear records in our CRM to track outbound sourcing activities and results.
Run A Clear & Efficient Pipeline Process

Implement and improve our existing system for evaluating and interviewing talent, which we call our “Talent Pipeline” process. The Pipeline will be tailored for outbound and inbound candidates as appropriate, and will result in a thorough, clear, and efficient evaluation process for all candidates. 

Key Responsibilities
  • Communicate with all candidates, acting as their guide through our interview, evaluation, and hiring process.
  • Administer various steps in our hiring process, including Predictive Index personality and cognitive testing, paid test projects, etc.
  • Work with internal and external stakeholders to create test project specifications for each role that we are sourcing for.
  • Report on pipeline metrics for every open role on a weekly cadence.
  • Ensure that every candidate feels as if we value their time and respect their willingness to engage with us, even if we decide that they're not a good fit for our team.
Implement Onboarding & Feedback Processes

Create an employee onboarding process for our internal hires and portfolio companies which will ensure that our newly recruited talent hits the ground running. Additionally, facilitate a feedback loop to gauge our own performance around the hires that we make. 

Key Responsibilities
  • Within 4 weeks, create an Onboarding Program that outlines the first two weeks of a new hire's experience.
  • Within 8 weeks, create and implement a formal feedback process for new hires to ask questions, describe their experience with our company, and identify opportunities to improve.

Community Change builds the power and capacity of low-income people, especially low-income people of color, to lead powerful and dynamic movements for social change.   • Manages the People (HR) Administration budget.

  • Proactively research and analyze talent trends to advance and further strengthen equitable and effective People Administration at Community Change/Action.
  • Perform data analyses and report out to help strengthen the staff experience and support the advancement of organizational goals.
  • Manage corporate insurance programs in consultation with leadership. .

Office/Facilities and Remote Workspace (15%)

  • Oversees and manages workspace - remote and office/physical workspaces.

  • Professional certification in Human Resources and/or related professions (SPHR/PHR or GPHR).

  • Proven experience in nonprofit HR/people administration and compliance.

CloserIQ is an industry leader in sales and engineering recruiting for high growth tech companies. Since 2014, we have served 500+ global employers and leading institutional investors. Our proprietary technology has helped us consistently deliver a world-class experience to employers and candidates.


We are hiring for an Executive Recruiter to join our Retained Search Practice. We've had an overwhelming amount of client demand since launching this division over a year ago, and are now ready to grow the team. Come help us build the executive suites for the next generation of B2B SaaS companies.

Our ideal candidate can lead executive-level searches, and work with founders and investors on advising all aspects of the talent funnel from search strategy to execution. This person may have previously hired for senior level GTM/Sales leaders at an agency or in house or is coming from the broader startup ecosystem where they can utilize their industry knowledge.


Responsibilities

  • Cultivate a diverse network of executive level candidates in the tech / startup industry.

  • Execute and ensure we deliver a world-class search experience across market research, candidate sourcing, interview preparation, and offer stage.

  • Lead our business development efforts to grow our search demand and global presence.

  • Manage our client experience across founders, investors, and executive candidates.

  • Help shape and drive our multi-year practice vision and growth strategy.

  • Prior experience working with founders within the startup ecosystem OR full-desk leadership recruiting experience at an agency or in-house.

  • Passionate about helping innovative startups build their executive and leadership teams and relentless drive to finish projects.

  • Intellectual curiosity, diplomatic negotiator, and thoughtful communicator.


The above job description is meant to describe the general nature and level of work being performed; it is not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required for the position.


CloserIQ is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to providing all employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. We celebrate diversity and welcome applicants from every background and life experience.

jobs.title: Technical Recruiting Lead
jobs.description:
Do you want to build the foundations of a better web alongside a passionate, high-impact team? Do you want to help tackle some of the most novel challenges in decentralized tech, working closely with our rapidly growing open source community and many of the best technologists in the world?
 
3Box Labs is on a mission to transform the web's relationship with data. Our identity and data infrastructure is already used by 1500 of the world's most ambitious applications. Ceramic Network, the recently launched sovereign data network we helped create, is the building block that will let millions of developers reinvent how they manage data.
 
We have huge and novel challenges ahead, as well as rapid growth and opportunity. We need impact-driven, intentional, fast-learning teammates to join us in realizing the vision of a more trusting and connected web.
 
The Role
Drive a recruiting and talent function that is hiring faster and better than a team of our size should reasonably expect, and lay the foundations for people operations that makes the whole team happier and more effective.



In this role you will..
  • Attract great candidates with a standout opportunity, evidently great team and mission, and effective sourcing strategies
  • Work with hiring managers create clear and compelling role specs, JDs, sourcing strategies, and evaluation plans
  • Help shape the employer brand, making it attractive to candidates and representative of the team they'll be joining
  • Deliver a fantastic candidate experience for all applicants, leaving them promoters of 3Box Labs and Ceramic
  • Help us become leaders in DEI in the Web3 space, putting effort into building a highly diverse pipeline ourselves and taking initiative on outside events, partnerships and other strategies to build equity and opportunity in the space
  • Ensure our interview paths and evaluations are high signal and efficient, constantly being improved based on data and changing scale
  • Help more of our team become expert at interviewing, evaluating and sourcing as you prime and coach them, directly and by finding external experts and trainings
  • Efficiently leverage external services and recruiters, and when the time comes hire exceptional recruiters internally
  • Bonus: help make our new hire onboarding and orientation is clear, effective and inspiring
  • Bonus: help create effective promotion pathways, feedback cycles, learning tools, and other internal talent processes.
  • Bonus: start to build clear pathways for community and part time contributors as well as full-time hires.
  • Bonus: organize processes, events/retreats, and rituals that bring the team together physically, intellectually and emotionally



You're likely a great candidate if you have...
  • Recruited engineers (or other technical roles) effectively across the globe
  • Ability to screen candidates for both technical ability and principles alignment
  • Mastery of core sourcing skills, strategies and tools and creative approaches to source pockets of elite or undiscovered talent that are likely to fit our team
  • Understanding of how to shape role requirements, starting with team needs and building towards a hiring plan and job spec
  • Great communication skills and a positive, engaging presence with candidates to represent our team well
  • Organized, diligent, and motivated to make an impact, whether that's filling the pipeline or closing candidates or spearheading a new DEI project
  • Great problem solving skills and resourcefulness -- you find needs and tackle them rather than waiting for instructions
  • A desire to stretch into new skills, responsibilities and expertises as the team grows
  • Bonus: experience with talent pathways, performance evaluation systems, learning programs, DEI initiatives, or other talent, people ops and community projects
The Team
We are a lean, voraciously curious team spread across Europe and the East Coast. We are impact driven, intentional about our role, communications and actions, and intensely focused on building quality tools for our open source community. We believe a better model for managing identity and data online can give power back to users and builders, that this model is key to a growing movement, and that our team is a critical part of making that movement successful.
 
We pay competitively and fairly across the globe, offer great and flexible benefits, and view everyone on our team as an owner -- both with generous equity grants and lots of agency to help set our direction.
 
We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. We cannot succeed in our mission without it. People that identify with groups traditionally underrepresented in tech are particularly encouraged to apply. 
 
Learn more about 3Box Labs here.

jobs.title: Recruiting Manager
jobs.description:
About Harvest

Harvest is an independent software company that makes tools to help businesses run more smoothly. We believe that businesses only succeed by using their time intentionally. Our products support our customers through time tracking, reporting, and forecasting features.

Harvest started in 2006 as a team of three and has grown to today’s current total of just over 60 lovely faces. We’ve worked as a remote team since the beginning and we continue to hire the right people for the job no matter where they call home.

We also strive to create a workplace culture where everyone feels valued, included, and heard. One important aspect of this is continuing to create spaces for diverse life experiences and work histories. If you are a member of a group that is historically underrepresented and disadvantaged in tech, business, and society in general, we want to meet you and we encourage you to apply.

What You'll Do

We are looking for a recruiting manager who will own Harvest's full-cycle recruiting, hiring, and selection process. This includes candidate sourcing, screening, interview scheduling, and selection, as well as leveraging their professional networks and relevant communities to market and advertise hiring needs. This position reports to the VP, People, and supports the People Team to meet organizational hiring objectives through the execution of recruiting activities.

Key responsibilities
  • Drive full-cycle recruitment—from sourcing to offers— for a variety of entry to senior-level positions across the business
  • Update current and design new recruiting procedures (e.g. job application and onboarding processes)
  • Ensure an outstanding candidate experience by being responsive, helpful, and friendly throughout the process
  • Lead intake meetings with hiring managers to understand their hiring needs and develop strategic sourcing and hiring plans
  • Guide hiring teams through the recruitment process, providing resources and training when needed while advising teams on best practices
  • Assist hiring managers in the creation and finalization of job descriptions
  • Schedules interviews; oversees preparation of interview questions and other hiring and selection materials
  • Utilize innovative sourcing techniques and strategies to find, connect with and recruit top-tier talent
  • Build a diverse pipeline of talent by researching and sourcing candidates using LinkedIn Recruiter, social channels, events, and referrals
  • Utilize our applicant tracking system to its fullest extent, maintaining all necessary application information and ensuring data integrity
  • Leverage data to improve recruiting efficiency, drive innovation, and influence hiring decisions
  • Identify opportunities to scale our brand across relevant industry and technical channels and execute

Requirements

You are:

  • Skilled at creating strong, trusting relationships with hiring managers and can effectively communicate with people of all levels
  • Committed to filling open roles though empathetic to candidate needs/decisions and find ways to overcome potential offer declines
  • Comfortable operating within a small team and enjoys creative problem solving
  • Data-driven and proactive about utilizing pipeline metrics to quickly work through any recruiting roadblocks


You have:

  • 5+ years of full-cycle recruiting experience, ideally hiring for senior-level tech roles (e.g. senior engineers)
  • A track record of successfully identifying, qualifying, and closing exceptional candidates across a wide variety of roles.
  • A passion and empathy for job seekers
  • An ability to embrace (and enjoy!) the ever0changin hiring landscape, both internally and in the candidate market

Benefits

At Harvest, our compensation consists of three main components:

  • A competitive base pay: Every Harvester with the same role expectations receives the same base pay. And we aim to pay at the top of the market (informed by third-party data) for all roles.
  • Individual and company performance bonus plans: We believe in rewarding performance, so all Harvesters are eligible to receive an individual and company performance bonus after working with Harvest for a period of time.
  • Competitive benefits*: We offer a number of benefits, including
    • 15 days of vacation in your first year, plus company holidays and a week off for winter break. And you’ll get an additional two days per year until you reach twenty days.
    • 100% coverage of health insurance premiums across our medical, dental, and vision plan offerings for you, your spouse, and your dependents
    • A yearly budget for your professional learning and development goals
    • 401k planning with a 6% company match after three months with the company
    • 16 weeks of paid family leave to all new parents with the option to use it all at once or throughout the baby’s first year as well as a virtual platform providing support across fertility, pregnancy, adoption, and through your first year of parenting
    • A charitable giving matching program to support your contributions to your favorite charitable organizations
    • And much more...


*Some of the benefits described are only available to U.S.-based Harvesters. Benefits information for non-U.S.-based Harvesters will be provided to individuals who interview for those roles.

We are not one of those. Nordcloud is here to present other companies latest technologies in the public cloud and to push the IT industry forward. We believe in frictionless future where everything is agile and scalable.

Do you thrive in the world of candidate sourcing and networking? Have you demonstrated success in providing high candidate flow that converts into actual hires? Do you excel in a fast-paced, hyper-growth, and ever-changing work environment? If yes to all, we want to hear from you! We need someone like you to ensure we stay on our growth track.

Experienced Talent Acquisition Partner come and join our friendly and ambitious team!

Your role

You work as a trusted Talent Acquisition Partner for our business leaders in Finland and in across Nordics, in close co-operation with our global Talent Acquisition team to find and engage with top talent. You know that you can't simply rely on job posts and understand how to be creative in your sourcing strategies to find the perfect candidates for your talent pipeline. You understand the importance of strong candidate pipelines and proactively seek out new ways how to strengthen those.

What you get to do every day…
  • You will be our in-house detective, researching the talent market and generating new strategies to attract top tier, passive candidates.
  • Generate a solid pipeline of pre-qualified and engaged candidates who are eager and enthusiastic about our opportunities.
  • Strategize with the team and find creative ways to build mature talent pipelines, referral generation, events and sourcing campaigns.
  • Track and report the best passive and active candidate sourcing channels.
  • Advocate and practice a candidate-centric approach to recruiting top talent that will generate candidate referrals.
  • Take full responsibility of end-to-end lifecycle of recruitment process for your positions, from defining requirements with hiring managers to screening, interviews and making offers as well as ensuring a smooth entry to our onboarding process.
What we want to see
  • Experience as a self-driven Recruiter with a technology company, start-up or agency experience looking to make a big impact in a growing company.
  • Proven track record of successfully identifying candidates for challenging Tech positions. under tight deadlines and the ability to work in a fast-paced, ever-changing work environment.
  • Fluent English and Finnish.
  • Resourceful and initiative, able to solve difficult research or sourcing challenges within an organization.
  • Eager to learn new technologies that support business needs and quick to pick up on tools and ways of working.
  • Committed and result-oriented approach to your work is essential to succeed in this role.
  • Experienced in social media apps and tools.
Why Nordcloud as your next career move?
  • International working environment – a team of 46+ different nationalities offers interesting career opportunities.
  • If you come from the agency recruiting field, this is your opportunity to enter the world of in-house recruiting!
  • As a Talent Acquisition Partner, you will be part of an expert team with an all-around skill set. We want you to bring in your share of wisdom and extend our own internal know-how and procedures too!
  • Freedom to choose your tools and ways of working, flexibility in working hours.
  • Nordcloud operates as a flat international organization, where exceptional talents can make a real impact.

+ Ambition! – we want to disrupt the industry and show other companies how the future looks like. We are determined to continuously develop ourselves and the business. It's an ongoing process and we love it!

Meet some of our team members in this video. Learn more about #NordcloudCommunity and get familiar with the idea of setting up Nordcloud by watching this video.

We are digital builders born in the cloud. Joining Nordcloud is the chance of a lifetime to leave your mark on the IT industry!

We are looking forward to hearing from you!

Send us your CV and/or LinkedIn profile by 20.9.2021 and we'll get back to you soon. Please include your salary expectation in your application.

Please read our Data Privacy Policy before applying. A valid EU working permit is required.

About Nordcloud

Nordcloud is a European leader in cloud implementation, application development, managed services and training. It's a recognised cloud-native pioneer with a proven track record helping organisations leverage the public cloud in a way that balances quick wins, immediate savings and sustainable value. As well as partnering with VMware, Nordcloud is triple-certified across Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform and Amazon Web Services – and is featured in Gartner's Magic Quadrant. Nordcloud has 10 European hubs, over 500 employees and has delivered over 1,000 successful cloud projects for companies ranging from mid-size to large corporates. IBM announced its acquisition of Nordcloud on December 21, 2020.
