jobs.description:
The Talent Manager will partner with the Head of Human Resources and support an incredible team of recruiters in managing open job requisitions and overseeing the day-to-day functions of recruitment, pre-employment, and new hire onboarding programs across the US and Canada. This role leads and empowers the recruitment team to ensure the acquisition of organizational talent in alignment with Spring’s mission and values.

Essential Functions and Responsibilities:

  • Drives talent acquisition initiatives by implementing a variety of strategies to source and attract talent across multiple regions in the US and Canada
  • Actively engages in and oversees full cycle recruitment activities in collaboration with recruiters and hiring managers
  • Directly responsible for management and integrity of Spring’s Applicant Tracking System (ATS) and related job boards
  • Ensures the successful development and fostering of community partnerships, in collaboration with our local recruiters, to build talent pipelines and promote being an employer of choice
  • Offers guidance and support to managers with workforce planning including the creation and maintenance of job descriptions and succession planning
  • Delivers and continuously develops engaging and effective on-boarding and orientation materials for all new hires to set them up for success
  • Collaborates with operational leaders to identify talent gaps, provide resources, and facilitate excellent hiring and retention practices
  • Supports leadership in creating a world class experience for high profile interviews and subsequent onboarding
  • Proactively researches and prepares staffing and talent acquisition plans for new clinic locations
  • Assists with exit interviews to identify hiring-related trends and make recommendations for retaining talent and improving the employee experience
  • Responsible for collection, evaluation, and reporting of analytics in relation to Spring’s talent programs and external market trends
  • Provide support to HR team in areas of employee programs and special projects relating to talent acquisition and retention
  • Maintains compliance with federal, state and local regulations, as well as company policy, as applicable to the areas above
  • Provides leadership and support to direct reports to further Spring’s talent and culture initiatives
  • Performs other duties as assigned

Requirements

Physical Demands

Must be able talk, express and exchange ideas clearly by spoken word. Must be able to hear at normal speaking level with or without accommodation. Ability to receive detailed information through oral and written communication. Required to have close visual acuity to operate computer terminal. Performs mostly sedentary work in an office environment. Ability to travel for key events and trainings preferred.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in human resources management, business administration or a related field
  • Minimum of 5 years of HR experience, with 2 years of experience in managing full-cycle recruitment activities, and at least 1 year of experience managing direct reports
  • Experience with talent reporting and analytics
  • Exceptional communication skills, written and verbal
  • Computer proficiency: Microsoft office 365, HRIS and ATS systems such as Workable or Lever
  • Experience in a healthcare and/or start-up environment desirable

Benefits

Investing in you today

  • Competitive Medical, Dental, and Vision Plans
  • Paid Time Off to enjoy “you” time!
  • Career development and cross-training opportunities
  • On-site snacks, snacks and more snacks! Let’s face it everyone loves snacks!

Investing in your future

  • 401k Match
  • Fertility Benefits Program
  • Paid Life and Disability Insurance
  • Career progression with a fast-growing company

jobs.description:
Who Are We? 

EasyHealth is on a mission to revolutionize the health experience.

We began as a tech enabled, distributed insurance agency. To deliver better health outcomes and member experiences, EasyHealth is going beyond health coverage to create connected health journeys that educate members about their benefits and and connect them with easy and accessible preventative care.

We're starting with the rapidly growing Medicare market, working to make a difference in the lives of 44 million Medicare eligible beneficiaries. We are a venture backed, rapidly growing startup with clear product-market fit and explosive growth.

Behind our product and member experience are the amazing teams driving it, connected in mission but spread across the globe. Despite our distance, we work together to create truly disruptive healthcare experiences!

We are looking for a creative and passionate Technical Recruiter to own and architect the recruiting experience for our technology career opportunities at EasyHealth.  In this role you will partner with the hiring managers  to manage all stages of the recruiting cycle from sourcing to hiring. You will also be responsible for supervising metrics that drive time to hire, candidate quality, and ensure an outstanding candidate experience focused on engagement and positivity. You ideally have experience performing full-cycle technical recruitment in a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment.

**This position is fully remote**

Quick Facts About EasyHealth

  • Founded: March 2020
  • Mission: To create better health outcomes for seniors
  • Vision: Build the first modern Medicare platform
  • Traction: Projecting a $100M+ run rate in 2022. One of the fastest growing insure-tech start-ups of all time.
  • Key investors: QED Investors, Anthemis, Healthy VC, Nationwide Insurance
  • Team size: 100+ full-time equivalents (May 2021) and targeting 400+ by end of 2022
  • Location: 100% remote (US required, preferably West Coast/Los Angeles)

What You'll Do:

  • Manage all stages of the recruiting cycle for technical roles across Cedar
  • Partner with hiring managers to build clearly-defined job descriptions
  • Source and outreach new candidates
  • Lead the interview process including crafting interview plans, keeping the pipeline moving in a timely manner, reference checks, and closing candidates
  • Handle candidate flow through Greenhouse, our applicant tracking system
  • Be the face of Cedar and ensure an exceptional candidate experience by identifying and anticipating candidate needs with clear communication throughout the process
  • Manage recruiting events, projects, or recruitment related processes
  • Maintain a culture that adheres to Cedar's values of focusing on our vision, using good judgment, staying positive, and disallowing mediocrity

Who You Are:

  • 3+ years of technical recruiting experience in a fast-paced company
  • Familiarity with recruiting tools and programs (Hiretual, LinkedIn, etc)
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong organizational skills and comfortable using metrics to guide decision-making
  • Experience working with multiple stakeholders and teams
  • Self-starter and excited to work in a changing environment
  • Highly motivated with a strong work ethic and good judgement

Why join us?

We value people who are bold, ambitious, clever, collaborative and customer-centric. We're a global community growing together.

If you love a challenge, enjoy solving meaningful problems, and want to be a part of one of the fastest-growing InsurTech startups, then EasyHealth is the team for you.

EasyHealth offers a unique work environment and the chance to collaborate with diverse teammates across continents. We'll provide freedom and tools to allow you to thrive at your best, and foster an environment you can do it in.

Key moment to join EasyHealth in term of growth and opportunities

Fast-learning environment, entrepreneurial and strong team spirit

Our people matter, we invest to help you unlock your full potential

Competitive salary package & benefits

jobs.description:
DockYard is looking for a Technical Recruiter who is passionate about developing relationships, learning more about state-of-the-art web applications, and helping others find the right fit.


Who We Are

DockYard is a digital product consultancy specializing in production-ready apps. DockYard offers a range of consulting services with capabilities in product planning, design, user experience (UX), full-stack engineering, and QA. Over the last decade, the company has solved complex product challenges for visionary brands like Netflix, Apple, Nasdaq, and Harvard.

We’re honored to have been included on guides ranging from Inc 5000 (2020, 2019) to Fast Company’s Best Places to Work for Innovators (2020) amongst others.


The Role

The Technical Recruiter will report directly to the Employee Experience Manager and work closely with the Chief People Officer to meet recruitment goals and foster an exemplary candidate experience. This role will assist in developing and executing a recruiting strategy including sourcing and expanding candidate pipelines. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who wants to grow and develop as a Recruiting and Employee Engagement professional!

The ideal candidate is a champion for diversity, equity, and inclusion, is self-driven, team-oriented, passionate about web technologies and recruitment best practices.


Responsibilities
  • Source, screen, interview, and evaluate candidates
  • Foster long-term relationships with candidates
  • Review and understand technical job requirement requirements
  • Review applicants to verify if position requirements are met
  • Assist in creating detailed job descriptions
  • Follow up with candidates
  • Assist in writing and posting technical job descriptions
  • Source potential candidates on niche platforms, like Linkedin and Github
  • Perform blind pre-screening calls to analyze applicants’ abilities
  • Interview candidates combining various methods (e.g. structured interviews, technical assessments and behavioral questions)
  • Own the onboarding process for all new hires
  • Meet regularly with department directors to forecast department goals and hiring needs
  • Participate in tech conferences and meetups to network with tech professionals
  • Promote company’s reputation as a great place to work
  • Keep up-to-date with new technological trends and products
  • Employee Engagement responsibilities as assigned

Requirements

Must Haves
  • 3-5 years of proven work experience as a Recruiter, preferably in the Tech space
  • Hands-on experience with various interview formats (e.g. phone, Google Hangouts, Zoom)
  • Technical expertise with an ability to understand and explain job requirements for software engineering (both front-end and back-end), design, and project management roles
  • Familiarity with Applicant Tracking Systems and resume databases
  • Solid knowledge of sourcing techniques (e.g. social media recruiting and Boolean search)
  • Passionate champion of Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
  • Ability to build strong relationships
  • Confident self starter
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Working knowledge of HR practices and labor legislation
Nice To Haves
  • Proficient understanding of Ember.js, Javascript, Ruby on Rails, Elixir, Product and Visual Design, and Project Management
  • Experience working in a remote team

Benefits

  • 100% fully distributed company.
  • Company provided Apple laptop
  • 100% company paid Medical plan option for you and your family
  • 100% company paid Dental, Vision, Life, and AD&D
  • 401k with employer match
  • Annual stipend for books, conferences, and trainings
  • Generous paid time off
  • Company Retreats
